column4: is anyone else having trouble with synaptic? "W: Couldn't stat source package list http://archive.ubuntu.com breezy/universe Packages (/var/lib/apt/lists/archive.ubuntu.com_ubuntu_dists_breezy_universe_binary-i386_Packages) - stat (2 No such file or directory)"
tried it, i get this error "Could not download all repository indexes"
the same thing
http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/breezy/universe/binary-i386/Packages.gz: Sub-process gzip returned an error code (1)
seveas, i forgot where the list is...
try "sudo rm /var/lib/apt/lists/*" then "sudo apt-get update" again
do you want to give me the commands again, incase you misspelt them?
did you try what I suggested?
after i entered the first command, it came up with another prompt (just the arrow)
that means you've got unbalanced quotes, or brackets, or some such
or that I did...
unbalanced quotes?
I put double quotes around the 2 commands.  you shouldn't.
rm: cannot remove `/var/lib/apt/lists/partial': Is a directory
I meant for you to copy the * but not the "
i did that
oh, that's ok then.  that error's to be expected.
do i go ahead with the next one? or will it not work?
yeah, go ahead :)
i think it worked, btw, when i typed apt-get update, did i enable the multiverse repositores?
no.  the stuff I told you to do didn't change anything other than fix the broken cache
